last_episode_to_air.name: Football might be over for you
last_episode_to_air.overview: As the season winds down, the graduating players plan their next moves while Beam pledges to make changes and build an even better team next year.

name: Last Chance U
overview: In a docuseries set at one of NCAA football's most fertile recruiting grounds, guys with red flags seek to prove their worth on the field and in class.

seasons.name: EMCC: Part 1
seasons.overview: Football prospects with academic and personal issues seek success on the field and in the classroom at powerhouse East Mississippi Community College.

seasons.name: EMCC: Part 2
seasons.overview: Buddy and Brittany welcome a new crop of budding football stars hoping to overcome past mistakes, while coping with the attention brought by Season 1.

seasons.name: INDY: Part 1
seasons.overview: The acclaimed series shifts to Independence Community College in Kansas, where a tough-as-nails coach attempts to rebuild a struggling program.

seasons.name: INDY: Part 2
seasons.overview: Coach Jason Brown experiences a new level of notoriety as he leads a loaded ICC roster into a season filled with national championship expectations.

tagline: The game's best come from a place you've never heard of.

episodes.name: Last Chance U
episodes.overview: Desperate for an opportunity at a major school, the players at East Mississippi Community College prepare for a season that's crucial to their future.

episodes.name: Most Dangerous Game
episodes.overview: The starting quarterback battle rages on. Brittany worries about the players' academic progress. EMCC's winning streak is threatened by a rival.

episodes.name: Plan B
episodes.overview: The coaches and players deal with unfamiliar adversity. DJ and others struggle with school. Ollie faces tough times and seeks comfort back home.

episodes.name: Homecoming
episodes.overview: Players, other students and the community prepare for homecoming weekend. Tensions rise at the homecoming game, prompting Buddy to lose his cool.

episodes.name: Blood Makes the Grass Grow
episodes.overview: DJ faces choices that will make or break his future. John hopes for a chance to impress Auburn coaches. Bad blood builds in the regular-season finale.

episodes.name: It Is What It Is
episodes.overview: The regular season comes to an explosive end, and the team must deal with the fallout from their actions. The players prepare for life after EMCC.

1.name: EMCC: Part 1
1.overview: Football prospects with academic and personal issues seek success on the field and in the classroom at powerhouse East Mississippi Community College.

episodes.name: Half a Team
episodes.overview: Buddy makes changes in response to the publicity the show brought to the EMCC program. The Lions are forced to play short-handed in the season opener.

episodes.name: Football Saved My Life
episodes.overview: De'Andre gears up for his first game since he was kicked out of Florida State. Isaiah and his brother open up about their difficult childhood.

episodes.name: Can't Make the Club in the Tub
episodes.overview: Brittany and Davern try to motivate Kam on and off the field. Isaiah's health concerns continue into a rivalry game against Itawamba.

episodes.name: Ain't It a Sin
episodes.overview: Faith takes center stage as Buddy, Dakota and others explore the role of religion in their football journey. A much-awaited rematch approaches.

episodes.name: For My Momma
episodes.overview: As EMCC prepares for the No. 1 team in the country, defensive linemen Chauncey, Kam and Tim continue their battle to atone for their past actions.

episodes.name: The Curse
episodes.overview: EMCC hopes to maintain its focus against winless Coahoma, a program trying to overcome a deficiency in talent, facilities and support.

episodes.name: Bigger and Better Things
episodes.overview: As the state playoffs loom, tensions rise between several players and the coaches. Brittany ponders her future at EMCC.

episodes.name: Last Man Standing
episodes.overview: It's crunch time as the players take finals and weigh scholarship offers while still holding aspirations of winning a national championship at EMCC.

2.name: EMCC: Part 2
2.overview: Buddy and Brittany welcome a new crop of budding football stars hoping to overcome past mistakes, while coping with the attention brought by Season 1.

episodes.name: We Expect
episodes.overview: After decades of losing, Independence Community College looks to brash coach Jason Brown to develop a winning culture and recruit talented athletes.

episodes.name: Humble Your Pie
episodes.overview: After the rough season opener, Coach Brown questions his D1 transfers. Malik and Carlos face tough love as they fight to meet expectations.

episodes.name: Jimmys and Joes
episodes.overview: Bad blood with his old boss fuels Brown's fire as the newly confident Pirates welcome defending national champion Garden City to Independence.

episodes.name: Get Outta Dodge
episodes.overview: Despite ICC's winning streak, tensions start to boil over as Brown gets fed up with his players and coaches before and during a game in Dodge City.

episodes.name: Out of State
episodes.overview: Brown and his players open up about their upbringings and how their relationships with family -- positive and negative -- shaped who they are today.

episodes.name: Neewollah
episodes.overview: The team prepares to play during the town's big annual festival. Bobby struggles to overcome frustration. An ICC student writes a song for the team.

episodes.name: Abracadabra
episodes.overview: As the Pirates get ready for a shot at a conference title, recruiters from four-year schools visit and players scramble to get their grades in order.

episodes.name: Dust in The Wind
episodes.overview: As a game against rival Coffeyville caps off the regular season, the ICC players and coaches reflect on the season and weigh their next moves.

3.name: INDY: Part 1
3.overview: The acclaimed series shifts to Independence Community College in Kansas, where a tough-as-nails coach attempts to rebuild a struggling program.

episodes.name: Dream U
episodes.overview: Jason Brown copes with his celebrity status. Bobby Bruce tries to rebound from bad decisions. Brown considers bringing back a polarizing player.

episodes.name: The Eye in the Sky
episodes.overview: Bobby gets close with Kailon, who tries to keep Bobby on the right path. Assistant coach Jason Martin talks about moving his family into a dorm room.

episodes.name: Home on the Range
episodes.overview: The town of Independence gets ready for the highly anticipated home opener. Visits with Chance’s and Kailon’s families shed light on their upbringings.

episodes.name: Garden City
episodes.overview: Hard feelings from last year rise to the surface in a rematch between ICC and Garden City, as coaches Jason Brown and Jeff Sims butt heads yet again.

episodes.name: The Hangover
episodes.overview: Jay’s injuries cause him frustration. Malik tries to make the most of his opportunities. Tensions run high after a game against Fort Scott.

episodes.name: S Show
episodes.overview: As players and coaches start to prioritize themselves over the team, Brown tries to regain control -- but a sideline outburst proves costly.

episodes.name: Famous Forever
episodes.overview: Locals grow restless over the team's performance amid budget cuts at ICC. A home game during the "Neewollah" festival could help unite the town.

episodes.name: Hustlers Survive
episodes.overview: The season finale presents a chance to end the season on a positive note. Markiese makes a big mistake, and Brown faces criticism over a text message.

4.name: INDY: Part 2
4.overview: Coach Jason Brown experiences a new level of notoriety as he leads a loaded ICC roster into a season filled with national championship expectations.

episodes.name: The Town
episodes.overview: Life is demanding for players at Oakland's Laney College, where they must pay for their own housing and expenses while pursuing a future in football.

episodes.name: QB4
episodes.overview: After 40 years, coach John Beam's legacy in Oakland is unmatched. Injuries lead to an unorthodox solution at QB as Laney looks to get back on track.

episodes.name: Cast-Offs
episodes.overview: Dior's strained relationship with his father affects his play and his health. Nu'u balances school, football and childcare while his wife works.

episodes.name: Greyhaven
episodes.overview: RJ lives for football, but is haunted by an infamous family history. Beam's old school ways don't always connect with the younger generation.

episodes.name: The City
episodes.overview: Rejzohn discusses a painful memory, then suffers a physical setback. Despite recent success, Laney still feels disrespected by a rival in San Francisco.

episodes.name: Ā, upane! ka upane!
episodes.overview: As Dior looks for a way out of California, Beam questions if Nu'u could commit to moving his family away from Oakland. RJ's frustrations mount.

episodes.name: New Oakland
episodes.overview: Gentrification in Oakland brings some positive changes, but pushes longtime residents out of the city. The Eagles begin a late push for a playoff bid.

episodes.name: Football might be over for you
episodes.overview: As the season winds down, the graduating players plan their next moves while Beam pledges to make changes and build an even better team next year.
